name: effulgence
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to shine brightly: The fire died down, marked only by a brief effulgence of a glowing ember. Dawn was near and the stars had lost their effulgence.
the state of looking very beautiful or being full of goodness: the dazzling effulgence of her beauty The paintings are like brilliant effulgences of rare blossoms. See
effulgent
More examplesFewer examplesHe preferred the continuum between gloom and effulgence of black and white photography.For sheer richness and effulgence of sound, the Vienna Symphony was more than matched by the historic Leipzig Gewandhaus Orchestra.There was a radiant effulgence to the paintings.
